content: Works flawlessly

Excellent app but please get rid of the are you finished box that comes up during an interval session as it is disrupting for any athlete to look at and doesn't go away until the rest time is over. App also needs more work on regular updates as it has never been updated in 6 months
App cannot get data from PM5 after workout complete. App cannot record workout in background. App cannot get HR from phone.

I don't like the app. The software upgrade to the PM5 unit on the rower caused my the phone app to stop connecting to the PM5. The 'edit' function on the app allows delete only, cannot add time and distance when the app and PM5 stop connecting. Previously,I would finish rowing and glance at the app to see what my detailed stats were (distance, length, strokes per x, etc.). Within seconds it would be wiped clean. I will remove the app after this comment, as using it only creates frustration.
Worked flawlessly the first three workouts. But now it will no longer connect.

update 8-Oct-20: After updating the PM5 firmware to 169 (Sept 2020) I can no longer get the app to connect for more than about a second......[old review] I originally rated this app as only 1 star, because I was unable to get it to function with my phone over a bluetooth connection. However, after spending some more time with it, I've finally got it working, and it's not bad at all. However some of my previous criticisms still stand. (1) The website make no mention of OS compatibility beyond 4.2 JellyBean which was 2012. (2) There is a lack of instruction generally about the bluetooth connectivity. Here are my top ErgData Bluetooth tips. (a) If Ensure that you pair the devices from ErgData app and not the Android settings. (b) Make sure the PM5 is set to Wireless ON (this does not seem to be retained) (c) Even if the ErgData app says it is connected under the bluetooth settings, don't believe it until you see a message that says "ready for workout" (or words to that effect) in green at the bottom of the ErgData screen.

Would be even better if it stored all the summary data from each session, like on the images shown when you open the app. For those complaining about it having to run in the foreground - if you want to watch a video while you train there's enough info on the c2 screen itself - if you can concentrate on a video you're not concentrating on your form and not working hard enough! 😘
Connectivity issues

I have used it five times, each time it drops connection in a 25 minute row. It fails as a background app, fails as an open app, also seems to block polar app from gathering heart rate data. This needs some serious work before it will be worth while. It's a shame as it would be great if it worked.

It works to get data to logbook. It does sometimes have connection issues. Bigger problem is that the app needs to be running in the foreground or else you lose your activity. This means you cannot have a video playing over top during workout or else risk not saving activity.
Garbage app, app cant even connect to the rowing machine using bluetooth. It connected once and then crashed. It no longer finds the rower. I guess making apps that work is hard.

It looks great. Like an attractive date until they start talking. Fails to connect, fails to stay connected. When it does connect and remain connected I love it. A dissapointment. I wish I could say more but I'm angry right now.
Seems to record the workouts and they are in the app but just will not upload them to the online logbook, have checked the username and password multiple time.
Will not connect to Samsung Galaxy S20
Won't connect to the PM5 very annoying

Only got a PM4 but have connected via usb which worked to my computer to update firmware. After doing this i tried connecting to phone with the usb and app and it doesnt work ive been to menu on monito it says no devices connected. Would upgrade to a PM5 but hardly seems worth it considering what i have read in these reviews

Seriously, what is it with the PM5 and Bluetooth devices? Whoever is maintaining your software, sack them. The rower is great. The build fantastic. The delivery, customer service, especially at these times was great and even the online log book is good but ... What I didn't expect was a device impossible to connect to, it really is an embarrassment to the Concept2 company.

Had to find the trick for it to connect seems to work best if Bluetooth is off then open the app it will ask if you want to connect through the app then seems to be okay otherwise found it does not find the pm5 even though Bluetooth says it's connected. Good app otherwise tracks all the workouts perfectly.

Does not handle bluetooth correctly. Cannot see pm5 or Suunto heartrate belt whereas the pm5 has no issues. A real pity for an otherwise excellent indoor rower. Concept2 should be aware that nowadays software is an equal part of any product.
Can't get the app to connect to my PM5 anymore.

I can get this to connect with my PM5 about 15% of the time. I have tried very hard to find a reason why it does not want to connect but it feels random. I have no idea why. I have never had so much trouble connecting my phone to anything, ever! Very disappointing. Updating the firmware actually made the problem worse! FIX THIS PLEASE!

This is one of the most annoying workout tracking Applications I have ever used, and is not of the quality that should be provided after spending over 1K on a rower - Especially since the rower will not interface with non proprietary workout applications. The application fails to save workouts when it gets hung up even if it is still connected to the rower (USB). I lose about 5% of the workouts. It also will not take information stored on the rower to recover workouts. It is a pain to get it to Bluetooth sync with the application each time, so I bought the USB cable. Even with the USB cable hooked up, the application ask to turn on blue tooth every time. You need to hire applications developers who TEST their products for the various configurations that it will be used in.
In the middle of a workout ErgData dropped Bluetooth so frequently that I gave up using a Bluetooth connection. I now connect ErgData to my PM5 via cable.
Easy to set up and use.
Sometimes stops and asked if I'm finished while I'm still rowing. No way to resume.
First rate. Syncs erg and heart monitor to logbook effortlessly every time. Haven't had any of the problems outlined by others.
There is absolutely no need for this app to need my location. Please tell me why this is the case.

It's a shame that a €1000 machine comes with an app that's still stuck in 2013 and numerous issues with data transfer on the PM5. Please, wake up and get the digital user experience on par with the mechanical. And why the heck is the app asking for access to my location?! I want to monitor my workout, not send data to the mothership.
From time to time, not sure if it is apps or phone.. i will like trying to connect for 30min before i give up and start rowing without Ergdata... very frustrating 😕
Excellent
Synced up with my pm5, started workout, finished workout, app failed to record workout. Now I have to manually log performance.. what's the point of using this app, then?

App not connecting to Bluetooth no matter how much I google troubleshooting .Uninstalled and installed several times . Using glaxay s20+ Hubby has no issues with the s9+ Bluetooth has no issues with any other devices .
Something changed and I'm no longer able to connect my PM3 using the cable. Plugging in the cable launches the PM3 on my rower but app acts like nothing is connected. Android v10
Could never get it to connect to my PM5
The app didn't save training in the logbook if it was running in the background when connected to PM4 via USB. Also it doesn't work with Magene H64 heart rate belt.
If you keep it up it works fine. If you open other apps and let it run in the background it stops working. Very annoying.
Woefully.. WOEFULLY outdated and completely hideous lacking any and all modern UX.. But it performs as advertised.

Could be better. PM5 says I'm connected, phone BT is connected , but ErgData app will not link up and will spend all it's time searching. Finally got it to work correctly before getting contacted by Concept2. Still a pain and way to many steps before it links up. I just wish the app was a quality product like the rower.
Worked for a couple of weeks on a PM3; thereafter, suddenly quit and just power cycled the phone.
Have tried to connect with 3 different machines and keep searching for it and never works

The app needs major updates. For example you must keep it open for it to track your workout, you cannot minimize to turn on your music or it will lose connection. If you want to listen to music you need to start that first and keep it playing while opening and running the app. The app connected and worked for about 1 week after which it refuses to connect to my rower. Tried new batteries, erasing the cache and memory on my phone and also reinstalling the app with no success.

Bluetooth connection drops at random moments. Sometimes after a couple of minutes, sometimes after 15. Very occasionally it lasts the whole workout. The rower is at my house, Samsung S8 is next it, bluetooth audio has no issues at al. When cycling I use a bluetooth HR + cadence meter for hours without any issues. Also JBL works from many meters away. Other users have the exact same issue with ErgData/PM5 - time to fix it and stop trying to find a fault with the users' setup.
Variable, sometimes connects, sometimes doesn't...rebooting app or phone doesn't always help. Garmin watch picks the rowing machine up though...
Great app!
Tha app runs ok on xiaomi with android 6. On a Huawei mate 10 with android 7 it doesn't find the pm5. Please fix it.

Could it have a cooler ui? Yes. Could it go above and beyond with cool new features to turn your concept 2 into a smart machine to rival peloton? Yes. Does it? No. But thats okay because it does exactly what I expected of it. I can connect my phone and log my workouts for export or casual analysis.
Customer support is a joke. Treat you like a 2nd grader. Sending them proof of concern gets you not my fault. Term snowflake come to mind.

Sometimes it works until the end of my workout. Sometimes, it loses the connection during workout, when this happens, your workout is gone. Sometimes, it works for 1 minute. Sometimes it works for an hour or until you're done. If you finish before you're cut off, your workout is saved. Otherwise, it's lost. If it cuts off, at least have a way to save the workout. But, starting and stopping and starting isn't exactly good either. It seems like others experience the same thing.
Good info, screen goes dark within 1 second of opening app or inbetween intervals is annoying. Constant aski g if your done inbetween intervals also annoying.
Doesn't save my data, I have to enter it manually each session. Super annoying
Excellent app for tracking your workouts

Amending my previous rating, which I scored low as the PM5 was failing to finalise connection to my Android. Tip if you are having connection problems between the PM5 and an Android phone: check the PM5 firmware is up to date as well as Ergdata. If connection doesn't work, go into Android system apps and clear data and cache. Then reconnect PM5 to the phone. I tried this, and the connection from PM5 to phone was immediate and robust again.

App won't connect to PM5 with latest firmware if I previously used 'disconnect' in the app. Only way round this is to uninstall the app, restart my Galaxy S7 and reinstall. As you can imagine this is a pain. When it is working it is great.
awesome. fantastic quality.

This app is a disgrace of Concept 2 machine. Such a great machine and such a crappy app. It looses connection way too often - nothing better than to be in the middle of 10k piece and realize that your app is no longer recording. Every workout becomes an adventure - will it get recorded properly, with per stroke data using ErgData, or will I have to use backup USB transfer and just get a basic data? My PM5 monitor is on latest firmware. My app is on latest firmware. My batteries are full. My PM 5 is plugged into wall adapter for good measure. The phone (Pixel 3) is in the official phone holder on the top of PM 5. And yet the connection still dies, and once it does, there's no way to get the data back.

I had been happily using this app for a couple of years now, no issues at all. Connecting to both erg and ski erg with PM5. This seems to have changed since the latest update. App still connects to the erg nicely, workout starts, screen shows data and things look fine. Then the connection drops after the first few seconds and never recovers. So I'm unable to use the app at all any more... It would be great to know if I can do anything to fix this!
Works well w/ pm5 with added cable. Would be nice to set time out function length, e.g still rowing, for interval training.

The ErgData app is glitchy. On a PM3 with current firmware, if you press the PM3 menu button and wait for a while before unplugging your USB cable, the workout will probably save to the app and sync to the online logbook, but no promises. The online logbook then "syncs" the activity type and date to Strava, but nothing else. The CSV, TCX and FIT files downloaded from the C2 logbook also do not transfer anything in a manual upload to Strava but the activity type and date--no time, distance, pace, watts, cal/hr, strokes/min, intervals, heartrate, etc.--nothing at all, which means both this app and the C2 online logbook are useless.
App cannot find Rower even when my phone is connected to it via Bluetooth. Struggling to find rowing joy atm. - Updated everything - rower, mobile, WiFi. App works well and is fun to use. Happy!

This app is great. I find it simplistic and have used it for recording my last 820k meters. Had an issue trying to connect on my phone. Had to uninstall and redownload on my s9 galaxy. Must have been an issue with an update.
Scanning for PM5 device.... like... forever
Frustrating app. I turned off the PM5 Bluetooth Enable temporarily. I then turned back on, but app is completely unable to reconnect even though Im connected on bluetooth to the PM5.

Looks ok, but will not connect to my PM5. Followed all the steps. Only connect via the app, it can see the PM5 but won't connect. I've tried on two different android phones. Tried taking the batteries out the PM5 to reset it
I've had zero issues with this app. NFC pair to my PM5, stick my phone the phone holder on top and go. The app looks a little outdated, but it works well for me.
Very useful app. Would love to see small heart rate graph over time. Please, convince Concept2 to allow firmware upgrades via this app for people who do not have macOS or Windows computers.

Initially disappointing for two weeks due to flaky Bluetooth connection and after ensuring all the needful was completed still not functioning at all. So decided to use my old Moto G 2nd generation iso my new Moto G8+ and got bluetooth connection immediately plus syncing with my C2 logbook is no problem. So, if the daft message "have you finished yes no" during interval sessions can be taken out, the app would be excellent.

Installed the app and connected to my rower. App said the PM5 needed a firmware update and as soon as I did that, the app would no longer connect to the rower. Never even got a chance to use it. When/if you ever decide to update the app, I'll install it again and try it.
Does not work with Garmin HRM 1G. Other apps connect and work fine with it.

The only way to upload the workout is with the usb driver. PM5 was supposed to send the workouts throughout Bluetooth. The app connects with the PM5. I can see in real time the workout I have on the PM5 display but when I ask to sync the workouts, the PM5 never sends the workouts to the erg app. If I upload my workouts with the usb driver to the server, then I can see the uploaded workout on ergdata. I have done everything they say on support. I am simply done. Very disappointed as everyone
Not connecting to pm5 since update. Would be great if it would sync with Google fit or fitness Pal or similar.

Absolutely NO issues. Works flawlessly on our Pixel 3as, and fire tablets. All data consistent and accurate between logbook, ergdata and the PM5. Ridic easy. pleasant surprise: it syncs and tracks your HR from your Ant+ device that you paired to your PM5! I'm assuming most complaints are due to user error- you have to make sure both your Bluetooth and GPS are on otherwise your device won't pair. BIG THANKS to the developers because it works EXACTLY as it should. Keep rowing.
Used to be really good, but it can't seem to pair with a PM5 after the last update. Phone sees the PM5, phone pairs with the PM5. Ergdata does not. Please fix.

Tirelessly takes far too long to connect to the bluetooth. There is an issue. Therefore i have to add most of my workouts manually. Not a cheap machine, but bob if the app doesnt work. Tried all efforts to connect. My 25 min workouts turn into over an hour just trying to get app to connect to the machine. After about 40 mins, i managed to connect. I had to uninstall and install again. Then it finally worked. Put me in a bad mood really, i just wanted a quick workout. Two stars
Superb system
Works as described, great app for tracking my workouts.
Works great. Connects to the Rower and my HRM. Syncs workouts fine. Just looks a little dated...could be great just needs a few more features and some lipstick.
Great when it stays connected to PM5
Works fine but I can not sync completed workouts from the PM5. It means I always need to start before I start rowing
Unable to get the app to connect to my pm5 despite my phone and the pm5 saying that they are connected.
Works perfectly for me. Syncs with online logbook just fine. I connect my phone by BT and my HR chest strap by ant. I gave it a four because I think the interface for sync etc is a bit unfriendly.

Connected to the rower via PM5 and recorded the activity, however it won't let me sync with the activity log. When I try and sign into my account from the app to sync says username and password credentials incorrect. Both username and password are correct. Disappointed with the app. Seems dated and complicated
Doesn't connect to pm3 with cable
Great if you have a PM5; saves time logging workouts, and captures & combines valuable data for visualization on the Concept2 logbook.
A little clunky seems to work ok

It wont connect to an android. I've attempted many times with 2 different phones. From day 1 of owning the machine it has not worked. Is it too much to ask to have a simple, reliable way to log workout and update firmware?

Has trouble at times connecting to PM3 through cable. Also is not an ANT+ app which is disappointing as it won't sink with my Garmin HR chest strap. When doing intervals it continues to ask if you are finished at every rest interval which is annoying. With the new update, USB connectivity has improved. Now to make it ANT+ and we'll have a winner!

The app spins endlessly trying to connect to my PM5 via Bluetooth. I have tried everything I can think of. Even unpairing all Bluetooth devices to see if there is a conflict, uninstalling and reinstalling, resetting phone? It has worked a few times and I love the extra data but I can't rate this higher unless I can use it.

Frustrating. Bluetooth connection is 50-50 and a USB stick throws faults on the PM5, so now I'm using an OTG adaptor with a 10 year old printer cable which still often results in sync errors. Why is it so difficult to make a file that's easy to get at for manual upload??
well, no updates and not syncing with any training watches like garmin, polar etc 🤔😏😏😏
Please provide the option of portrait layout.

Excellent when working smoothly, bit tricky to get the hang of. One major flaw: the "Are you finished?" prompt is poorly designed. Should match positive affirmation of intent commonly seen in the English speaking world... "Are you still [blank]?". Yes, yes I'm still rowing. Compare this to Yes, I'm not rowing, or No, I am rowing.
Unreliable Bluetooth connections. I have one rower. Latest firmware. Phone fully updated. App unreliable.

All I really want is the bare minimum of reliably saving my workout data to the online logbook. Well, My partner and I had to switch to the USB connection because bluetooth wasn't reliable enough over the course of a workout and the app couldn't recover effectively from a dropped connection even though the PM5 was still collecting data. Not a huge issue but dumb. My recurring problem with the app is that when you're finished with a workout, the app appears to automatically detect it and pop up a tiny dialog box asking if you're done. This is the only way to save your workout on the app, and if you touch the screen anywhere but the even tinier "YES" on the dialog (can just a word without a border even be called a "button"?), your workout data vanishes from the app. There is no other way to save the workout data from the app but that dialog, and it will only show up once so you better hit that "button" exactly right the first time. Yes, you can enter the data manually and yes, you can save it on the PM5, copy it off to USB, and upload it to the logbook. Both of these methods make me question why I'm bothering with the app at all. Overall the app needs to be more robust and fault tolerant.
Edited: it seems working. I didn't try it yet in the long run. The paring isn't user friendly. Old: APP not working on PM5 it recognizes the device but data aren't displayed.
Good app, yet lacks synchronization with Google Fit.
A mobile app from the 2000s. You got the rowing machine but your app is 20 years old! 👎
I waste more time attempting to connect the app to my rower than necessary.
It disconnects in the middle of workouts! Terrible!
Great addition to my training. Enjoy how is synchronises with my C2 account.
Why does the app need to know my location?

Generally great idea for tracking your progress. Gripes include a poor interface which will not rotate and it's constantly stops and loses the current work out. Not sure if this is just an issue between a PM5 and Pixel 4 XL but it's frustrating as half of my work outs are lost in this way.
Pretty good app. Connects easily via Bluetooth. Syncs well with the online logbook. Would like to see the app able to drive firmware updates, as the Concept2 firmware update process is a mess.

Edit - user error, you can have watts by tapping it 🙄 Only first use today but seems ok, a title showing what the numbers are would be good for those of us new to rowing and also a full list of info from the machine, my partner judges her rows based in watts and this is not included on the app
Couldn't connect to the rower on 2 different days.

Horrible Bluetooth connectivity, have tried many emails with support, asked for help on forum, no help. Maybe 1 out 4 times it will connect. Have tried "everything"! Very very disappointing when you have a phenomenally built rower but the software/app is garbage....... Update - small glitch in the app which is "easily" recified manually on my phone and works flawlessly now.

UPDATE--Thanks I just received a response via email an it worked. I don't normally have my location services on, an all i had to do was turn on to make it work. Thanks guys. I can't seem to get the Ergdata to connect to the via Bluetooth to my S10+. I've looked up all the info I can but no luck. is there a patch or trick that I'm missing.

Great app to monitor additional units (such as HR, drag factor and etc.) during the workout on PM5 and makes a lot easier to upload workout to the logbook. It also adds HR, pace and stroke rate charts to the workout which is sometimes very usefull.
Works flawlessly with my machine and the online logbook. Great information and easy to see.
unreliable Bluetooth connectivity continuing. Reload app twice and now not logging my sessions on phone app when it does connect
Mint
Nice but recurring trouble uploading to other apps.
Have to restart phone everytime I want to connect to the ergo. Otherwise it's a great app.
App worked fine on Samsung s9, connected 1st time to erg at local gym. Nice to save workouts!

It was cool the one or two times I could get it to connect to my concept 2, but there's no point in the app if it doesn't record every workout. It's just easier to record them on paper and enter into the online logbook than to sit there fiddling with it all for x amount of time trying to get it to work before every session. I don't know if the problem is the app, my phone (doubt it-- it's a brand new phone), or the PM5, but most of the time it won't connect so I'm uninstalling.
Thus app is a POS . GARBAGE

First erg, connected perfect out of box. Finished two workouts and synced. Next workout it connects and at the end notice its not connected anymore. Can't get it to connect, can see and pair with it from Android but the app is not showing the pm5. Cleared the app cache and storage restarted phone and removed battery and replaced from pm5 and was able to reconnect... Now nothing not even reinstalling the app worked. Might be worth open sourcing everything so the community can make it work...

Would be worthwhile if connections to the PM5 weren't dropped during 2 out of 3 workouts. I know it's free but come on, it should at least work and I see from other reviews I'm not alone with this issue.
Connects ok to the PM5 via Bluetooth however it will then drop connection intermittently. Pretty disappointing for an expensive product.

Absolutely horrid app! Tried the app last month and it not only would save workouts, but prevented the PM5 from saving it either. Decided to attempt to use the app again, except this time not only did it not save my data (and yes I'm running the most up to date firmware) it gave me a hard fault error on the PM5 causing me to have to do a factory reset, losing ALL my workouts and lifetime meters!

Connection to PM5 now requires location services to be turned on. Why is Concept 2 spying on me? Edit 20/12/19: since the last updates, the BT connection with the PM5 doesn't work anymore. Makes the app totally useless.

Functionally superb. I've never had a problem with the app. However I'd love to see Google Fit integration and a lick of polish to the UI. Edit: Constantly loses login credentials on Android 10. Please fix.

I placed my phone infront of the moniter on the bike erg and it a screen came up and it went to the android store and there is this app... I've now stopped biking and I've spent 10 minutes trying to figure if this is done through contact, the camera, bluetooth... how did you do that? *mind blown*

Dec 11: I was contacted by support, which was not necessary in the end, as the latest update of the app fixed the Bluetooth connection issue. I do like the quick Bluetooth button. Thanks! Dec 3: I've had a great experience with the app until today. The app would not connect to the PM5. It could see the monitor, but nothing happened when I pressed connect (it usually connects on its own). I hope this is fixed soon.
Needs Google fit integration
Cannot connect to latest versions of android
Mediocre functionality. It seems easier just to input data to fitness tracker manually.

The heart rate data in the log page has disappeared. Just done a workout. Heart rate shown in latest workout but all previous logs have lost their Heart rate data. I have checked the Concept 2 on line log and the heart rate data is still there, so not completely lost, just a pity that it has gone from the app. Otherwise I quite like the app. Useful way of getting workout data captured. Thanks.

It used to work, now since the update it doesn't connect or I get hard reset errors. Yes, I've logged off and logged on again, changed password, etc to no avail. In the description of the update it says I need a beta version of the firmware as opposed to the standard firmware, but I cannot find it in concept2's website.
Very useful!
It repeatedly will not sync with online logbooks when updated, gives error messages. Very frustrating to have to go through repair steps. I Just want to workout and get it logged.

Garbage. Utter garbage. Crashes the machines screen requiring hard reset and won't record data. Making this useless and have no record anywhere of the workout. Half the time won't even connect. So glad I wasted my money on this machine that can't track a thing for me. I could have bought something for 80% less and been manually logging workouts. Like I have to anyway with a machine that can't record a damn thing.

Do all the things it should, but interface could be nicer, specially with the force rotate system, and I have to login after each update. You could also make a b/w screen when all data accessible but with low power for amoled displays. Otherwise I'm glad that app exists.

Usually happy with this app. Can't sync with my erg since the update. Sent email requesting help... I saw the comments in logging in/out to sync with logbook. My issue was pairing the app with my erg after update. Initially logging in/out didn't work for this, but tonight it paired fine. I'm happy it's fixed! Wish I knew what problem was to begin with...
Rubbish on Android. Clearly iOS is all that matters. Really annoying. Just won't sync. Keeps coming up with some rubbish about scope. Total waste of time !!
Stopped syncing to website. Can't even manually sync it anymore.
Don't even come close to this app. I can't even express how frustrated I am with Bluetooth connection! Absolute nightmare for £850...

This app works fine for me on my android phone. Bit of a scare today, since my phone updated last night to the latest version and would not save my workout data. Re-authentication solved that issue, but I had to hunt for that, since I did not know my phone updated. Please put up a pop-up if the app is updated and requires user interaction. Just failing to upload without any other notification than some JSON error isn't nice. Other than that, no data drops or any other issues.
Cannot login to logbook after the most recent update.
Most recent update disconnects randomly from our Concept 2 rowing machine. Thought this issue was fixed with the previous release. Note I have to figure out how to downgrade.

Recent update broke the sync function as cant upload 10/25's rowing data. Getting json error no value found. Odd as i do see 10/25 data in the app after this morning's session. ------ Rechecking again after reading updates notes: Never mind - all had to do was log out and back in after the update and that fixed the sync issue. Probably good practice to do that as i see lot of reviews encountering similar situation - just log off and back in to regain functionality.
Irritating app.
Got everything i need. Connected to my rowing monitor with ease.
App starts it's service randomly and can't seem to kill it.
Bug report: the screen blinks and data stops updating whenever my Bluetooth mouse connects or disconnects. I have to leave the app and come back to get it working again.

Utter garbage. C2 have no interest in anything other than iOS. Frequent connection drops with the equally useless PM5 monitor, this means you'll loose all the interesting training data and can't rank your workouts as the PM5 is low state tech from about the mid 1990's and records the bare minimum of information. Screen isn't formatted well on my Pixel 2 XL, which is just pure laziness, but to be honest one glance at this absymal app shows that it was knocked out badly in about an hour.
The app is a perfect companion of Concept 2 and of your weareble for heart rate monitoring.
Will only connect occasionally. Which is not an acceptable when trying to track your workout progress I do not recommend this app
Works fine for me. Could need a little more alerting visuals when app not start ready against pm5.

App shows it's connected and displays real-time data during the work out, but has suddenly stopped recording my data (saving my activity) upon completion of the activity. Even worse my data isn't saved to the PM5's internal memory. This happens regardless of the method of the connection ( Bluetooth and USB Wired).

Was working fine Sunday the 25th. Now today the 27th it failed to save my workout. At the end it thought the workout was still active. If it helps I'm pretty sure my phone installed the latest patch today (pixel 2, Android 9)
Garbage. Almost never connects via Bluetooth to rower; therefore, can't track workouts. What's the point then?
After two workouts the app just stopped to synchronize my workouts and doesn't load the online book. My phone is Samsung note 9

Frustrating app. 1st: Requires "location" on phone to be enabled to find C2; not sure why as bluetooth alone should be sufficient (must be to collect user metadata). 2nd: App will ask if workout is finished during setup of "Work of the Day" when it senses pause, developers need to add more time before prompt. 3rd: Sync to Logbook is not seemless. You have to be signed to online and app accounts prior to workout. I'll stick to using the C2 screen, my Garmin watch, and Garmin app interface for now.

When it connects its useful. But it stops connecting and I can't get it to connect anymore. I waste 5 mins before my workouts every time trying to connect but it fails. At this point, I have given up on it.
App back to normal! Thanks for listening and fixing the bugs! Haven't had a single issue since the last update.
Looks like the update fixed the problem of your app randomly opening. Will respond if it happens again. Gave 5 stars

Collecting the various metrics on my progress would be easy too.       Todays For instance: Short 21 minutes with rate increase Row a single 21 minute piece. Row the first six minutes @ 20 spm. Then row five minutes @ 22 spm, four @ 24, three @ 26, two @ 28 and one @ 30.  Medium 10,000m with rate changes every 2000m: 22-24-26-28-24 Row for a total of 10,000 meters at a sustainable intensity, varying your stroke rate as follows: row 2000 meters @ 22 spm, 2000 meters @ 24 spm, 2000 meters @ 26 spm, 2000 meters @ 28 spm, and 2000 meters @ 24 spm.  Long 2 x 21 minutes with rate increase / 4 min easy Row two 21 minute pieces. Row the first six minutes @ 20 spm. Then five minutes @ 22 spm, four @ 24, three @ 26, two @ 28 and one @ 30. Works perfectly (Sony Xperia GO 4.1), a really good tool. However, how hard would it be to get it to record continuous data, ie at the end of each stroke, to give a graphical output of the session. All other sports software does this, and it seems a trivial bit of programming.  The output should be available as a standard data file (eg gpx), readable by the more common applications like Sport tracks, Golden Cheetah etc. The output should have time, HR, power, speed, all of which are used to calculate overall fitness levels by these programs.
